entries.meaning: (organic chemistry) A phenolic derivative of glycine, N-(4-hydroxyphenyl)glycine, used as a photographic developer.
examples: Glycin is a versatile paper developer that produces a strong, deep black on bromide papers and brown to sepia tones on warm-tone chloride and chlorobromide papers.
The level of glycin (Table 4) in the serum and the plasma of autistic patients does not show consistent changes.
